modules.description: Provides functions to parse and format field specifications, including alignment, padding, and type conversion. Works with strings, integers, and custom format descriptors to generate structured output. Used to implement consistent formatting in log messages and data serialization.

Converts an error representation to a human-readable string, supporting detailed diagnostics. Works with a custom error type that encapsulates error codes and contextual information. Used to generate logs and user-facing messages in system validation workflows.

Converts SQL state codes to custom error representations and vice versa, with a string serialization method. Works with SQL state strings and an opaque error type. Used to standardize error handling in database interaction layers.

Provides functions to create, schedule, and cancel asynchronous alerts with timestamps and priority levels. Works with structured data including event identifiers, timestamps, and severity levels. Used to manage user notifications in real-time applications, such as sending alerts when system thresholds are exceeded.

Establishes and manages PostgreSQL database connections, executes SQL queries, and processes result sets with type-safe operations. Works with connection objects, query parameters, and result rows represented as tuples or custom types. Enables direct interaction with database schemas, supporting transactions and prepared statements for data retrieval and modification.

Handles PostgreSQL connection initialization with configurable behavior. Accepts connection parameters and manages non-blocking connection setup through polling. Used to establish database links in applications requiring controlled or asynchronous connection handling.
